=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
This game is a classic-style arcade space shooter with a twist of tower‐defense elements. Here’s a breakdown:

1. Genre & Setting:
 • It’s a space shooter where you pilot a spaceship (the avatar) in a fixed, grid-like level.
 • The setting features a static “base” (a planet) that likely serves both as a defensive asset and a critical part of the level’s layout.
 • Enemies in the form of aliens—some of which are bomber types that drop bombs—come from invisible spawn points (portals) that gradually release foes.

2. Mechanics:
 • Movement & Firing: You control the spaceship (FlakAvatar) and use projectiles like missiles and blue “sam” bullets to engage enemies.
 • Enemy Types: There are different aliens:
  – “alienBlue” (spawned slower from one type of portal) and 
  – “alienGreen” (spawned faster from the other portal).
 • Enemy Weapons: Some aliens drop bombs (red objects moving downward) aimed at your base.
 • Collision Interactions: 
  – If your avatar collides with an alien, the alien is destroyed but you lose points.
  – Your projectiles can kill enemy sprites (aliens, bombs) and sometimes score points when interacting with your base.
  – Bombs hitting your base will destroy both the bomb and your base, indicating that protecting your base is important.
  – There are interactions that even give you bonus points (for example, when an alien is taken out using the “sam” bullet).

3. Objective & Win/Loss Conditions:
 • Primary Goal: Clear the screen of enemy aliens and their associated portals.
 • Win Condition: You win when there are no enemy aliens or spawn portals left on the board.
 • Lose Condition: The game ends in defeat if your spaceship (avatar) is destroyed (sprite count reaches zero).

4. Overall Strategy:
 • Defensive Offense: Your primary goal is to eliminate enemy aliens as quickly as possible, especially focusing on disabling the portals to stop the incoming waves. Since portals continuously spawn enemies, taking them out is crucial.
 • Protect Your Base: Since bombs can damage or even destroy your base, you should maneuver to intercept bombs and keep the base shielded from direct hits.
 • Avoid Harmful Collisions: Colliding head-on with an alien or a bomb can be costly—not only risking your ship but also causing point penalties. Use your movement and projectiles wisely to neutralize threats before they reach you.
 • Tactical Projectile Use: Aim carefully with your missiles and “sam” bullets. Some interactions provide positive scoring (like when an alien is hit by sam, adding extra points), so prioritize those shots when possible.
 • Balance Risk and Reward: Use the game’s static obstacles (the planet/base and other level features) to your advantage. Position yourself so that you can efficiently target waves of aliens, minimize exposure to incoming bombs, and keep a safe distance when needed.

In simple terms, steer your spaceship to destroy the enemy aliens and shut down their spawn points, all while dodging enemy bombs and protecting your base. Focus your firepower on the portals first to stop the incoming threat, then deal with the remaining aliens—all while avoiding crashes that could cost you points or your ship. This balance of offense and defense is key to mastering the game.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
